item.title: Amid Venezuela tumult, U.S. wants Latin American countries to lead in finding a solution
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: The Biden administration has preferred to let leaders of Colombia, Brazil and Mexico take the lead pressuring the Maduro government, but a more active U.S. role may be inevitable.

item.title: Nearly 100 killed in Israeli strike on school, Gaza officials say
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Hajar Harb, Mohamad El Chamaa, Adela Suliman, Kelsey Ables
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said Hamas fighters had been operating in the Gaza City school. Eleven children and six women were among those killed, a Gaza official said.

item.title: Cartel boss ‘El Mayo’: I was detained before meeting with politician
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The Sinaloa cartel chief said El Chapo Guzman’s son invited him to a meeting with Sinaloa’s governor, but he was ambushed and then flown to the United States.

item.title: The 2024 Paris Olympics, in comics
item.dc:creator: Robyn Smith, Hannah Good, Vidhya Nagarajan, Lisa Hanawalt, Colleen Tighe
item.description: We asked our favorite cartoonists to watch and live illustrate the 2024 Paris Summer Games.

item.title: Ukraine appears to expand Russia incursion, in morale boost for Kyiv
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Anastacia Galouchka
item.description: Ukrainian forces have continued to push deeper into Russia, further signaling this operation wasn’t a short raid but rather a potential occupation.

item.title: Plane carrying 62 people crashes in Brazil with no survivors, official says
item.dc:creator: Marina Dias, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The governor of São Paulo state said he had been informed there were no survivors on Voepass Flight 2283 from Cascavel to São Paulo.

item.title: China courts developing nations in its push to build a new world order
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Vic Chiang
item.description: Beijing is forging ties in the “Global South” not just with money but also by lending political support based on antipathy toward the American-led order.

item.title: U.S. says cartel infighting led to capture of ‘El Mayo’ and El Chapo’s son
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The U.S. ambassador’s account is the first official explanation of the mysterious flight that carried two Sinaloa cartel leaders to the United States last month.

item.title: U.S. will fund Israeli unit accused of gross human rights abuses
item.dc:creator: John Hudson
item.description: The determination ends a lengthy investigation of the Netzah Yehuda battalion, an ultra-Orthodox Israeli unit implicated in the death of a Palestinian American.

item.title: U.S. restarts offensive weapons sales to Saudi Arabia after lengthy ban
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: The sale to Saudi Arabia of certain U.S. weapons was frozen in 2021 to signal the Biden administration’s disapproval of the Saudi war with Yemen’s Houthis.

item.title: Moscow rushes to send troops as Ukrainian attack on Kursk tests Kremlin
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton, Francesca Ebel
item.description: The incursion by Ukrainian forces into western Russia posed the biggest challenge for President Vladimir Putin since the 2023 uprising of Wagner mercenaries.

item.title: Catalan leader Puigdemont in Belgium after fleeing Spain, he says
item.dc:creator: Beatriz Ríos, Ellen Francis
item.description: An official with Carles Puigdemont’s separatist party said he was returning to Belgium, where he has been based since staging a 2017 referendum for Catalan independence.

item.title: Catalan leader Puigdemont reemerges in Spain, then vanishes, evading arrest
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Beatriz Ríos
item.description: Carles Puigdemont had been in self-imposed exile since a bid for Catalan independence in 2017. His return is a challenge to Spanish authorities.

item.title: Vietnam accelerates island building to challenge China’s maritime claims
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Laris Karklis
item.description: As tensions mount in the South China Sea, Vietnam is dredging and filling in land, fortifying barriers and erecting new structures to create hundreds of acres.

item.title: South Korea recycles 98% of its food waste. What can it teach the world?
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Julie Yoon
item.description: Almost all leftovers from homes and restaurants are turned into compost, animal feed and even energy. But its model isn’t easy to replicate.

item.title: Britain’s riots put spotlight on far-right misinformation
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Social media posts — including a few by X owner Elon Musk — have played a crucial role in accelerating rage and misinformation.

item.title: U.S., Egypt, Qatar urge Israel, Hamas to restart Gaza cease-fire talks
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: Israel said it would send a delegation to the resumed negotiations, to be held in Cairo or Doha, Qatar. Hamas gave no immediate response.
